japanese:
うーん！
やっぱり体を動かすのは気持ちいいです。
translation:
Ahhh!
It feels so good to move my body.

japanese: はあ、はあ……。
translation: Haah, haah...

japanese: あれ？　大丈夫ですか？
translation: Oh? Are you alright?

japanese: お、おう、これくらい問題ない。
translation: Y-yeah, I'm fine, it's not a big deal.

japanese:
（なんて言ってしまったが、正直、
　四葉が俺に合わせて泳いでくれなかったら
　とっくに置いてかれてたな）

疲れたらすぐに言ってくださいね。
無理は禁物です。
translation:
If you get tired, please let me know.
Pushing yourself too hard is not a good idea.

japanese:
わかってる。
この後に備えて体力を温存しとかないとな。
translation: I know. I need to conserve my energy for later.

japanese: ですね、省エネモードでいきましょう。
translation: Yep. Let's go into energy-saving mode.

japanese:
（らいはと他の奴らは……
　またずいぶんと浅いところにいるんだな。
　あれじゃ、泳ぐと言うより水遊びだ）
translation:
(Raiha and the others...they're still in
 a pretty shallow area. It's not so much swimming
 as it is playing in the water.)

japanese:
（まあ、あの深さなら
　らいはも溺れる心配はないか）
translation:
(At least at that depth, I won't have to worry
 about Raiha drowning.)

japanese:
こうして青い海に浮かんで、
青い空をぼ～っと眺めるのも悪くないですねぇ。
translation:
It's not so bad to float in this clear blue sea,
gazing at the bright blue sky.

japanese:
もっと水温が低いかと思ったが、むしろ快適だな。
このシーズンでもいけるのは、さすが沖縄だ。
translation:
I thought the water would be colder, but it's really
quite comfortable. It's no wonder that even this
time of year, you can swim here. Okinawa, right?

japanese:
泳いでいる人も少ないですし、
まるで私たちの貸し切りみた……うひゃ！？
translation:
There aren't many people swimming here,
so it's almost like we have the place to
ourselves... UHWAA?!

japanese:
な、なんだ？
急に変な声を出して。
translation:
Wh-what?
Why did you suddenly do that weird noise?

japanese: い、いま……なにかが私の足を触ったような……。
translation: S-something...touched my foot just now...

japanese: まさか、サメ！？
translation: Could it be, a shark?!

japanese: ……なんでいきなりサメなんだよ。
translation:
...Why would there be a shark here
all the sudden?

japanese:
ほら、パニック系の映画だと
大体こういうシーンでサメがドバーンって
出てくるじゃないですか。
translation:
Come on, in movies that have a lot of thrilling
scenes, sharks usually appear with a pow!

japanese:
眩しい日差しに輝く青い海。
波間で楽しそうに遊ぶ１組の男女。
translation:
The shining blue sea reflecting the dazzling sunshine.
A man and woman play happily in the waves.

japanese: やがて流れ始める不穏な音楽――
translation: Suddenly, ominous music begins to play%p-2;――

japanese:
振り向いた２人の目の前には、
この世のものとは思えない巨大なサメが！
そして響き渡る悲鳴！
translation:
The two turn around to see an enormous shark,
its size seeming almost unreal!
Screams echo out!

japanese:
ううう……。
哀れ２人はお腹が空いたサメのご飯に……。
translation:
Oooohh...
The poor couple has become the meal
of the hungry shark...

japanese:
それはエンターテイメントの演出だぞ。
現実ではありえん。
translation:
But, that's just entertainment.
It's not real.

japanese:
はっ！？
もしかして、私たちが気がついてないだけで
すでに巨大サメがコッソリと背後に！
translation:
Huh?! Could it be
that there is already a giant shark
lurking behind us right now?!

japanese:
だから、こんな浜辺近くに
大きなサメなんて来ねぇって。
translation:
Come on. There wouldn't be any big sharks
that come near a beach like this.

japanese:
上杉さん？
そういうセリフを言った人から餌食になるのが
お約束ですよ？
translation:
Um, Uesugi-san?
People who say things like that
are usually the first to become prey you know...

japanese: お前は映画の見すぎだ。
translation: You watch too many movies.

japanese:
あっ！？
いま……上杉さんの後ろでなにかが……。
translation:
Ah?!
There's... something behind you right now,
Uesugi-san...

japanese: は？
translation: Huh?

japanese:
って、なにもいないじゃないか。
まったく焦らせ――
translation:
There's nothing there.
You're just trying to scare me%p-2;――

japanese: わあっ！？
translation: Waah?!

japanese: おい、四葉！？
translation: Hey, Yotsuba?!

japanese: うわっ！？
translation: Uwaa?!

japanese:
（なんだ？　引きずり込まれた！？
　まさか本当にサメが――）
translation:
(What's going on? Did something just drag me down?!
 Is there really a shark%p-2;――%p;)

japanese: んぐ……んんん！？
translation: Nngh... Nnnnnnh?!

japanese:
（四葉か！
　こいつ、なにを……）
translation:
(Yotsuba?!
 What's she doing...)

japanese:
（もしかして俺を驚かそうとしたのか？
　おいおい、子供っぽいことしやがって）
translation:
(Was she trying to surprise me?
 Oh come on, how childish.)

japanese:
（一瞬、本当にサメが出たかと思っちまったが
　……まあ、四葉が無事ならいいか）
translation:
(For a moment, I really thought it was a shark...
 Well, as long as Yotsuba is okay.)

japanese: （それにしても……）
translation: (Even still...)

japanese: ぷはぁ～！
translation: *gasp!*

japanese:
ぶはっ！
はあー……。
translation:
Haahh!
Haahh...

japanese: びっくりしました？
translation: Did I surprise you?

japanese:
当たり前だろ？
サメじゃなく四葉が襲ってくるとはな。
translation:
Obviously.
I didn't see a Yotsuba attack coming,
as opposed to a shark attack.

japanese:
ししし～。
ドッキリ大成功ですね。
translation:
Hee-hee-hee.
My prank was a great success.

japanese:
（屈託なく笑いやがって。
　でも、それが四葉のいいところで――）
translation:
(She's laughing like she doesn't even have a care.
 But that's one of the things I like about Yotsuba%p-2;――%p;)

japanese: （俺が好きなところ、なんだよな）
translation:
(It's one of the things
 that made me want to date her.)

japanese: ……上杉さん？
translation: Uesugi-san?

japanese: あ、ああ、いや……その……。
translation: Aahhh, um...well...

japanese:
すみません。
ちょっと、くっつきすぎでしたね。
translation:
Sorry.
I got a little too close, didn't I?

japanese:
別にこれくらい……
付き合ってるんだし、いいんじゃないか？
translation:
It's not that big of a deal...
We're dating after all, so it's okay, right?

japanese:
でも、ほら！
いまはみんなだっているわけですし！
translation:
But, look!
Everyone else is right over there!

japanese: それに水着ですし……。
translation: Plus, we're in swimsuits...

japanese: ……それ、よく似合ってるぞ。
translation: Yours... It looks good on you.

japanese: へっ？
translation: Huh?

japanese:
（し、しまった！　唐突すぎたか！？
　だがタイミング的は間違ってないはずだよな！？）
translation:
(O-oh no! Was that too sudden?!
 But, that was perfect timing, wasn't it?!)

japanese:
な、なんか急に暑くなってきちゃいましたね！
もうちょっと泳ぎましょうか！
translation:
It got hot all the s-sudden, didn't it?!
Should we swim a little more?!

japanese:
じゃあ、行きましょう！
それっ！
translation:
All right, let's go!
Woo-hoo!

japanese:
あっ、おい！
ちょっと待て！
translation:
Ah, hey!
Wait a second!

japanese:
（全力で泳ぎ始めた四葉になんとか追いついたのは、
　浜辺に上がってからだった……）
translation:
(I'd managed to catch up to Yotsuba, who'd started
 swimming with all her might, but only after
 we got out of the water and onto the beach...)
